method.name: GetPoint
method.comment: World contact point (point of intersection)

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.B2World
class.event: PreSolve (Contact As B2Contact, OldManifold As B2Manifold)
PostSolve (Contact As B2Contact, Impulse As B2ContactImpulse)
RayCastCallback (Fixture As B2Fixture, Point As B2Vec2, Normal As B2Vec2, Fraction As Float) As Float

method.name: DestroyBody
method.comment: This automatically deletes all associated shapes and joints. This function is locked during callbacks.

method.name: RayCast
method.comment:
Ray-cast the world for all fixtures in the path of the ray, going from FromVec to ToVec. Your callback controls whether you get the closest point, any point, or n-points. The ray-cast ignores shapes that contain the starting point.
The RayCastCallback event will be raised. The return value from this event determines the behavior: 0 - Terminate the ray cast. Fraction - Clip the ray to this point. 1 - Do not clip the ray and continue. -1 - Ignore this fixture.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Initializes the world and sets its gravity.

method.name: TimeStep
method.comment:
Take a time step. This performs collision detection, integration, and constraint solution.
TimeStep - the amount of time to simulate, this should not vary. VelocityIterations - for the velocity constraint solver. PositionIterations - for the position constraint solver.

method.name: CreateVec2
method.comment: Created a B2Vec2 vector.

method.name: QueryAABBToMapOfBodies
method.comment: Queries the world for all fixtures that potentially overlap the given AABB. Returns a Map with the bodies as keys. The map values are not used.

method.name: CreateBody
method.comment: Create a rigid body given a definition. This function is locked during callbacks.

method.name: FirstContact
method.comment: Returns the first contact. Note that the list of contacts includes non-touching contacts. Example: Dim contact As B2Contact = world.FirstContact Do While contact <> Null If contact.IsTouching Then '... End If contact = contact.NextContact Loop

method.name: QueryAABBToListOfFixtures
method.comment: Queries the world for all fixtures that potentially overlap the given AABB. Returns a List. Each item in the list is a B2Fixture.

property.name: Locked
property.comment: Returns True if the world is currently locked for changes.

property.name: AllBodies
property.comment: Returns a list with all the bodies.

property.name: DynamicBodies
property.comment: Returns a list with all the bodies with dynamic body type.

property.name: Gravity
property.comment: Gets or sets the world gravity.

method.name: Equals
method.comment: Tests whether the two vectors are equal.

method.name: Set
method.comment: Set the vector component-wise.

method.name: SubtractFromThis
method.comment: Subtract another vector from this one and return result - alters this vector.

method.name: AddToThis
method.comment: Add another vector to this one and returns result - alters this vector.

method.name: MultiplyThis
method.comment: Multiply this vector by a number and return result - alters this vector.

method.name: CreateCopy
method.comment: Creates a copy of the current vector.

method.name: NormalizeThis
method.comment: Normalize this vector and return the length before normalization. Alters this vector.

method.name: Negate
method.comment: Return the negation of this vector; does not alter this vector.

property.name: LengthSquared
property.comment: Return the squared length of this vector.

property.name: Length
property.comment: Return the length of this vector.

method.name: MultiplyRot
method.comment: Multiplies the vector with the transformation rotation matrix.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Creates a new identity transform.

property.name: Translation
property.comment: Gets or sets the translation caused by the transform

property.name: Angle
property.comment: Gets or sets the rotation caused by the transform

method.name: ComputeAABB
method.comment: Computes the shape AABB based on the passed transform. The result is stored in the Output object.

method.name: TestPoint
method.comment:
Test a point for containment in this shape. This only works for convex shapes.
Transform - the shape world transform. Point - a point in world coordinates.

property.name: Radius
property.comment: Gets or sets the radius of the underlying shape. This can refer to different things depending on the shape type.

property.name: ShapeType
property.comment: Returns the shape type which is one of the SHAPE constants.

method.name: ComputeAABB
method.comment: Computes the shape AABB based on the passed transform. The result is stored in the Output object.

method.name: TestPoint
method.comment:
Test a point for containment in this shape. This only works for convex shapes.
Transform - the shape world transform. Point - a point in world coordinates.

property.name: Radius
property.comment: Gets or sets the radius of the underlying shape. This can refer to different things depending on the shape type.

property.name: ShapeType
property.comment: Returns the shape type which is one of the SHAPE constants.

method.name: ComputeAABB
method.comment: Computes the shape AABB based on the passed transform. The result is stored in the Output object.

method.name: TestPoint
method.comment:
Test a point for containment in this shape. This only works for convex shapes.
Transform - the shape world transform. Point - a point in world coordinates.

property.name: Radius
property.comment: Gets or sets the radius of the underlying shape. This can refer to different things depending on the shape type.

property.name: ShapeType
property.comment: Returns the shape type which is one of the SHAPE constants.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.B2Shape.B2EdgeShape
class.comment: A line segment (edge) shape. These can be connected in chains or loops to other edge shapes. The connectivity information is used to ensure correct contact normals.

method.name: ComputeAABB
method.comment: Computes the shape AABB based on the passed transform. The result is stored in the Output object.

method.name: TestPoint
method.comment:
Test a point for containment in this shape. This only works for convex shapes.
Transform - the shape world transform. Point - a point in world coordinates.

property.name: Radius
property.comment: Gets or sets the radius of the underlying shape. This can refer to different things depending on the shape type.

property.name: ShapeType
property.comment: Returns the shape type which is one of the SHAPE constants.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.B2Shape.B2ChainShape
class.comment: A chain shape is a free form sequence of line segments. The chain has two-sided collision, so you can use inside and outside collision. Therefore, you may use any winding order. Connectivity information is used to create smooth collisions. WARNING: The chain will not collide properly if there are self-intersections.

method.name: GetEdge
method.comment: Copies the edge to OutShape.

method.name: ComputeAABB
method.comment: Computes the shape AABB based on the passed transform. The result is stored in the Output object.

method.name: CreateLoop
method.comment: Create a loop. This automatically adjusts connectivity.

method.name: CreateChain
method.comment: Create a chain with isolated end vertices.

method.name: TestPoint
method.comment:
Test a point for containment in this shape. This only works for convex shapes.
Transform - the shape world transform. Point - a point in world coordinates.

property.name: Radius
property.comment: Gets or sets the radius of the underlying shape. This can refer to different things depending on the shape type.

property.name: EdgeCount
property.comment: Returns the number of edges.

property.name: ShapeType
property.comment: Returns the shape type which is one of the SHAPE constants.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.B2Shape.B2PolygonShape
class.comment: A convex polygon shape. Polygons have a maximum number of vertices equal to 8. In most cases you should not need many vertices for a convex polygon.

method.name: SetAsBox2
method.comment: Creates a box polygon. HalfWidth / HalfHeight - Box dimensions. Center - Box center in local coordinates. Angle - Box rotation in local coordinates (radians).

method.name: Set
method.comment: Creates a convex polygon. Maximum number of vertices is 8.

method.name: SetAsBox
method.comment: Creates a box polygon.

method.name: ComputeAABB
method.comment: Computes the shape AABB based on the passed transform. The result is stored in the Output object.

method.name: GetVertex
method.comment: Gets the vertex at the given index.

method.name: TestPoint
method.comment:
Test a point for containment in this shape. This only works for convex shapes.
Transform - the shape world transform. Point - a point in world coordinates.

property.name: Radius
property.comment: Gets or sets the radius of the underlying shape. This can refer to different things depending on the shape type.

property.name: VertexCount
property.comment: Returns the number of vertex.

property.name: ShapeType
property.comment: Returns the shape type which is one of the SHAPE constants.

method.name: NextFixture
method.comment: Returns the next fixture. Returns Null if this is the last fixture.

method.name: SetFilterBits
method.comment: Limited to lower 16 bits. CategoryBits - A bit (or more) that defines the current fixture. Default value: 1. MaskBits - Bits defining the other fixtures that will collide with this fixture. Default value 0xFFFF.

property.name: Restitution
property.comment: The restitution (elasticity) usually in the range [0,1].

property.name: Shape
property.comment: Get the child shape. You can modify the child shape, however you should not change the number of vertices because this will crash some collision caching mechanisms.

property.name: IsSensor
property.comment: A sensor shape collects contact information but never generates a collision response.

property.name: Friction
property.comment: The friction coefficient, usually in the range [0,1].

property.name: Body
property.comment: Get the body that this fixture is attached to.

property.name: Density
property.comment: The density, usually in kg/m^2

method.name: SetFilterBits
method.comment: Limited to lower 16 bits. CategoryBits - A bit (or more) that defines the current fixture. Default value: 1. MaskBits - Bits defining the other fixtures that will collide with this fixture. Default value 0xFFFF.

property.name: Restitution
property.comment: The restitution (elasticity) usually in the range [0,1].

property.name: Shape
property.comment: The shape, this must be set. The shape will be cloned when the fixture is created.

property.name: IsSensor
property.comment: A sensor shape collects contact information but never generates a collision response.

property.name: Friction
property.comment: The friction coefficient, usually in the range [0,1].

property.name: Density
property.comment: The density, usually in kg/m^2

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.B2Contact
class.comment: A contact between two bodies. Note that a contact is created whenever the bodies AABBs overlap. Check IsTouching to find whether the two bodies are actually touching.

method.name: NextContact
method.comment: Returns the next contact or Null if none. Should only be used with contacts accessed with World.FirstContact. To avoid creating new objects the current object will point to the next contact.

method.name: GetWorldManifold
method.comment: Gets the world manifold.

method.name: GetManifold
method.comment: Gets the contact manifold.

property.name: IsEnabled
property.comment: Enable/disable this contact. This can be used inside the pre-solve contact listener. The contact is only disabled for the current time step (or sub-step in continuous collisions).

property.name: FixtureB
property.comment: Returns the second fixture.

property.name: FixtureA
property.comment: Returns the first fixture. Note that the order of fixtures is not consistent.

property.name: IsTouching
property.comment: Returns true if the two bodies are actually touching.

method.name: SetTransform
method.comment:
Set the position of the body's origin and rotation. This breaks any contacts and wakes the other bodies. Manipulating a body's transform may cause non-physical behavior. Note: contacts are updated on the next call to World.TimeStep().
Position - the world position of the body's local origin. Angle - the world rotation in radians.

method.name: GetLocalVector
method.comment: Gets a local vector given a world vector.

method.name: GetContactList
method.comment: Returns a list with the body contacts. TouchingOnly - If False then the list will include non-touching collisions (based on the bodies AABBs).

method.name: GetWorldPoint
method.comment:
Get the world coordinates of a point given the local coordinates.
LocalPoint - a point on the body measured relative the the body's origin.

method.name: GetLocalPoint
method.comment: Gets a local point relative to the body's origin given a world point.

method.name: ApplyTorque
method.comment:
Apply a torque. This affects the angular velocity without affecting the linear velocity of the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
Torque - about the z-axis (out of the screen), usually in N-m.

method.name: DestroyFixture
method.comment:
Destroy a fixture. This removes the fixture from the broad-phase and destroys all contacts associated with this fixture. This will automatically adjust the mass of the body if the body is dynamic and the fixture has positive density. All fixtures attached to a body are implicitly destroyed when the body is destroyed.
This function is locked during callbacks.

method.name: CreateFixture2
method.comment:
Creates a fixture from a shape and attach it to this body. This is a convenience function. Use FixtureDef if you need to set parameters like friction, restitution, user data, or filtering. If the density is non-zero, this function automatically updates the mass of the body.
Shape - The fixture shape. Do not reuse this shape! Density - the shape density (set to zero for static bodies). This function is locked during callbacks.

method.name: ApplyLinearImpulse
method.comment:
Apply an impulse at a point. This immediately modifies the velocity. It also modifies the angular velocity if the point of application is not at the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
Impulse - the world impulse vector, usually in N-seconds or kg-m/s. Point - the world position of the point of application. Wake - also wake up the body

method.name: CreateFixture
method.comment: Creates a fixture and attach it to this body. Use this function if you need to set some fixture parameters, like friction. Otherwise you can create the fixture directly from a shape with CreateFixture2. If the density is non-zero, this function automatically updates the mass of the body. Contacts are not created until the next time step. This function is locked during callbacks.

method.name: ApplyForceToCenter
method.comment:
Apply a force to the center of mass. This wakes up the body.
Force - the world force vector, usually in Newtons (N).

method.name: GetWorldVector
method.comment:
Get the world coordinates of a vector given the local coordinates.
LocalVector - a vector fixed in the body.

method.name: ApplyAngularImpulse
method.comment:
Apply an angular impulse.
Impulse - the angular impulse in units of kg*m*m/s

method.name: ApplyForce
method.comment:
Apply a force at a world point. If the force is not applied at the center of mass, it will generate a torque and affect the angular velocity. This wakes up the body.
Force - the world force vector, usually in Newtons (N). Point - the world position of the point of application.

property.name: LinearVelocity
property.comment: Get or sets the linear velocity of the center of mass. Do not modify the returned vector.

property.name: Position
property.comment: Get the world body origin position. Do not modify.

property.name: IsBullet
property.comment: Is this body treated like a bullet for continuous collision detection?

property.name: LinearDamping
property.comment: Get or set the linear damping of the body.

property.name: BodyType
property.comment: Gets or sets the body type.

property.name: SleepingAllowed
property.comment: Get or set whether sleeping is allowed.

property.name: AngularDamping
property.comment: Get or set the angular damping of the body.

property.name: Awake
property.comment: Get or set the sleeping state of this body. A sleeping body has very low CPU cost.

property.name: Mass
property.comment: Get the total mass of the body. Usually in kilograms (kg).

property.name: IsColliding
property.comment: Returns true if the contact list is not empty. Note that the list includes non-touching contacts.

property.name: Angle
property.comment: Get the angle in radians.

property.name: FirstFixture
property.comment: Returns the first fixture.

property.name: WorldCenter
property.comment: Get the world position of the center of mass. Do not modify.

property.name: GravityScale
property.comment: Gets or sets the gravity scale.

property.name: Inertia
property.comment: Get the central rotational inertia of the body. Usually in kg-m^2

property.name: AngularVelocity
property.comment: Gets or sets the angular velocity. Measured in radians/second.

property.name: Transform
property.comment: Gets the body transformation.

property.name: LocalCenter
property.comment: Get the local position of the center of mass. Do not modify.

property.name: FixedRotation
property.comment: Get or set whether this body have fixed rotation. Setting causes the mass to be reset.

property.name: LinearVelocity
property.comment: The linear velocity of the body in world co-ordinates.

property.name: Bullet
property.comment:
Is this a fast moving body that should be prevented from tunneling through other moving bodies? Note that all bodies are prevented from tunneling through kinematic and static bodies. This setting is only considered on dynamic bodies.
You should use this flag sparingly since it increases processing time.

property.name: AllowSleep
property.comment: Set this flag to false if this body should never fall asleep. Note that this increases CPU usage.

property.name: Position
property.comment: The world position of the body. Avoid creating bodies at the origin since this can lead to many overlapping shapes.

property.name: LinearDamping
property.comment: Linear damping is use to reduce the linear velocity. The damping parameter can be larger than 1.0f but the damping effect becomes sensitive to the time step when the damping parameter is large.

property.name: BodyType
property.comment: Get or set the body type.

property.name: AngularDamping
property.comment: Angular damping is use to reduce the angular velocity. The damping parameter can be larger than 1.0f but the damping effect becomes sensitive to the time step when the damping parameter is large.

property.name: Awake
property.comment: Is this body initially sleeping?

property.name: Active
property.comment: Does this body start out active?

property.name: Angle
property.comment: The world angle of the body in radians.

property.name: GravityScale
property.comment: Experimental: scales the inertia tensor.

property.name: AngularVelocity
property.comment: The angular velocity of the body.

property.name: FixedRotation
property.comment: Should this body be prevented from rotating? Useful for characters.

method.name: TestOverlap
method.comment: Returns true if this AABB overlaps the Other AABB.

method.name: Combine
method.comment: Combine this AABB with the Other AABB.

method.name: Contains
method.comment: Returns true if this AABB contains the Other AABB.

property.name: BottomLeft
property.comment: Returns the bottom left point. You can modify it.

property.name: TopRight
property.comment: Returns the top right point. You can modify it.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.joints.B2WheelJoint
class.comment: Wheel joint definition. This requires defining a line of motion using an axis and an anchor point. The definition uses local anchor points and a local axis so that the initial configuration can violate the constraint slightly.

method.name: NextJoint
method.comment: Returns the next joint. Returns Null if this is the last joint.

property.name: AnchorA
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyA in world coordinates.

property.name: AnchorB
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyB in world coordinates.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: MaxMotorTorque
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor torque, usually in N-m.

property.name: MotorEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the motor is enabled.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: JointSpeed
property.comment: Gets the current joint speed in radians per second.

property.name: MotorSpeed
property.comment: Gets or sets the motor speed in radians per second.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Sets the bodies and the anchor based on the current positions.

property.name: DampingRatio
property.comment: Suspension damping ratio, one indicates critical damping.

property.name: MotorEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the motor is enabled.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: CollideConnected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the attached bodies can collide.

property.name: MaxMotorTorque
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor torque, usually in N-m.

property.name: MotorSpeed
property.comment: Gets or sets the motor speed in radians per second.

property.name: FrequencyHz
property.comment: Suspension frequency, zero indicates no suspension.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.joints.B2WeldJoint
class.comment: A joint that strictly connects two bodies together.

method.name: NextJoint
method.comment: Returns the next joint. Returns Null if this is the last joint.

property.name: AnchorA
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyA in world coordinates.

property.name: AnchorB
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyB in world coordinates.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Sets the bodies and the anchor based on the current positions.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: CollideConnected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the attached bodies can collide.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.joints.B2RopeJoint
class.comment: A rope joint enforces a maximum distance between two points on two bodies. It has no other effect.

method.name: NextJoint
method.comment: Returns the next joint. Returns Null if this is the last joint.

property.name: AnchorA
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyA in world coordinates.

property.name: AnchorB
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyB in world coordinates.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: MaxLength
property.comment: Gets or sets the rope maximum length.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Sets the bodies and the local connections points.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: CollideConnected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the attached bodies can collide.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.joints.B2RevoluteJoint
class.comment: A revolute joint constrains two bodies to share a common point while they are free to rotate about the point. The relative rotation about the shared point is the joint angle. You can limit the relative rotation with a joint limit that specifies a lower and upper angle. You can use a motor to drive the relative rotation about the shared point. A maximum motor torque is provided so that infinite forces are not generated.

method.name: NextJoint
method.comment: Returns the next joint. Returns Null if this is the last joint.

method.name: SetLimits
method.comment: Sets the lower and upper limits measured in radians.

property.name: JointAngle
property.comment: Gets the current joint angle in radians.

property.name: AnchorA
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyA in world coordinates.

property.name: AnchorB
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyB in world coordinates.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: MaxMotorTorque
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor torque, usually in N-m.

property.name: UpperLimit
property.comment: Gets the upper limit in radians.

property.name: MotorEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the motor is enabled.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: LimitEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the limits are enabled.

property.name: LowerLimit
property.comment: Gets the lower limit in radians.

property.name: JointSpeed
property.comment: Gets the current joint speed in radians per second.

property.name: MotorSpeed
property.comment: Gets or sets the motor speed in radians per second.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Sets the bodies and the anchor based on the current positions.

method.name: SetLimits
method.comment: Sets the lower and upper limits measured in radians.

property.name: MotorEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the motor is enabled.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: LimitEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the limits are enabled.

property.name: LowerLimit
property.comment: Gets the lower limit in radians.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: CollideConnected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the attached bodies can collide.

property.name: MaxMotorTorque
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor torque, usually in N-m.

property.name: UpperLimit
property.comment: Gets the upper limit in radians.

property.name: MotorSpeed
property.comment: Gets or sets the motor speed in radians per second.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.joints.B2PrismaticJoint
class.comment: A prismatic joint. This joint provides one degree of freedom: translation along an axis fixed in bodyA. Relative rotation is prevented. You can use a joint limit to restrict the range of motion and a joint motor to drive the motion or to model joint friction.

method.name: NextJoint
method.comment: Returns the next joint. Returns Null if this is the last joint.

method.name: SetLimits
method.comment: Sets the lower and upper limits measured in meters.

property.name: AnchorA
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyA in world coordinates.

property.name: JointTranslation
property.comment: Gets the current joint translation in meters.

property.name: AnchorB
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyB in world coordinates.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: UpperLimit
property.comment: Gets the upper limit in meters.

property.name: MotorEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the motor is enabled.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: LimitEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the limits are enabled.

property.name: MaxMotorForce
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor force, usually in N-m.

property.name: LowerLimit
property.comment: Gets the lower limit in meters.

property.name: JointSpeed
property.comment: Gets the current joint speed in meters per second.

property.name: MotorSpeed
property.comment: Gets or sets the motor speed in meters per second.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Sets the bodies and the anchor based on the current positions.

method.name: SetLimits
method.comment: Sets the lower and upper limits measured in meters.

property.name: MotorEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the motor is enabled.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: LimitEnabled
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the limits are enabled.

property.name: MaxMotorForce
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor force, usually in N-m.

property.name: LowerLimit
property.comment: Gets the lower limit in meters.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: CollideConnected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the attached bodies can collide.

property.name: UpperLimit
property.comment: Gets the upper limit in meters.

property.name: MotorSpeed
property.comment: Gets or sets the motor speed in radians per second.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.joints.B2MotorJoint
class.comment: A prismatic joint. This joint provides one degree of freedom: translation along an axis fixed in bodyA. Relative rotation is prevented. You can use a joint limit to restrict the range of motion and a joint motor to drive the motion or to model joint friction.

method.name: NextJoint
method.comment: Returns the next joint. Returns Null if this is the last joint.

property.name: AnchorA
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyA in world coordinates.

property.name: AnchorB
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyB in world coordinates.

property.name: AngularOffset
property.comment: Gets or sets the target angular offset of BodyB relative to BodyA.

property.name: LinearOffset
property.comment: Gets or sets the target linear offset of BodyB relative to BodyA.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: MaxMotorForce
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor force, usually in N-m.

property.name: CorrectionFactor
property.comment: Gets or sets the position correction factor [0, 1].

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: MaxMotorTorque
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor torque, usually in N-m.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Sets the bodies. BodyB moves relatively to BodyA.

property.name: AngularOffset
property.comment: Gets or sets the angular offset of BodyB relative to BodyA.

property.name: LinearOffset
property.comment: Gets or sets the linear offset of BodyB relative to BodyA.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: MaxMotorForce
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor force, usually in N-m.

property.name: CorrectionFactor
property.comment: Gets or sets the position correction factor [0, 1].

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: CollideConnected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the attached bodies can collide.

property.name: MaxMotorTorque
property.comment: Gets or sets the maximum motor torque, usually in N-m.

method.name: NextJoint
method.comment: Returns the next joint. Returns Null if this is the last joint.

property.name: AnchorA
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyA in world coordinates.

property.name: AnchorB
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyB in world coordinates.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: CollideConnected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the attached bodies can collide.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.joints.B2DistanceJoint
class.comment: A distance joint constrains two points on two bodies to remain at a fixed distance from each other. You can view this as a massless, rigid rod.

method.name: NextJoint
method.comment: Returns the next joint. Returns Null if this is the last joint.

property.name: AnchorA
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyA in world coordinates.

property.name: AnchorB
property.comment: Gets the anchor point of BodyB in world coordinates.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

method.name: Initialize
method.comment: Sets the bodies and the Connection points.

property.name: DampingRatio
property.comment: Spring damping ratio, one indicates critical damping.

property.name: BodyB
property.comment: Gets the second attached body.

property.name: BodyA
property.comment: Gets the first attached body.

property.name: CollideConnected
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the attached bodies can collide.

property.name: FrequencyHz
property.comment: Spring frequency, zero indicates no suspension.
